neighbors.name: William Sugimatsu & Davis et al.
neighbors.claims: Harlan County property records show parcel 280002200 is co-owned by William Sugimatsu along with members of the Davis family ([Harlan County Assessor](https://harlan.gworks.com)). Public records identify a William Sugimatsu Davis who graduated from the University of Nebraska Omaha in 1999, suggesting the owner may be an absentee individual with the full name William Sugimatsu Davis ([UNO Commencement](https://digitalcommons.unomaha.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1029&context=commencement_programs)). No reference to Sugimatsu or the Davis co-owners was found in county board minutes or local news archives, suggesting they have no public community roles ([Harlan County Board](https://harlancounty.ne.gov/board_meetings/minutes.aspx)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach privately via established local contacts. Given the likely absentee status and lack of local political footprint, emphasize financial benefits and low-impact land management to address property value and contracting concerns.

neighbors.name: Jeremy D. & Erin M. VanBoening
neighbors.claims: Dr. Jeremy D. VanBoening and Dr. Erin M. VanBoening are veterinarians who have co-owned the Republican Valley Animal Center in Alma, Nebraska since 2003 ([Republican Valley Animal Center](https://www.repvalleyanimal.com/meet-the-staff)). Jeremy VanBoening currently serves as the Chairman of the Harlan County Planning & Zoning Commission, a role with direct oversight of renewable energy regulations ([Harlan County Planning Commission](https://harlancounty.ne.gov/pdfs/planning_zoning/Planning%20Commission%20Members.pdf)). In late 2024, he advised the Board of Supervisors regarding wind energy setbacks and moratoriums, recommending against the immediate adoption of certain regulations to allow for further data gathering ([Harlan County Board Minutes Nov 2024](https://harlancounty.ne.gov/posting_files/pdfs/board/minutes/2024/20241106_164106_board_minutes.pdf)). He was raised on a crop and livestock farm near Blue Hill, NE, and specializes in cattle embryo transfer ([Republican Valley Animal Center](https://www.repvalleyanimal.com/meet-the-staff)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Chairman of Harlan County Planning & Zoning Commission

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage strictly through official regulatory channels regarding project specifics. Acknowledge his leadership role in the Planning Commission and demonstrate how the project aligns with the data-driven zoning goals he has publicly advocated for in 2024.
